Submodules¶

pyLiveKML.KML.GeoCoordinates module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.GeoCoordinates.GeoCoordinates(lon: float = 0, lat: float = 0, alt: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: object

The GeoCoordinates type describes a single instance of a Lon-Lat-Alt (LLA) position, as used in Point, LineString and LinearRing objects. Note that the GeoCoordinates type is not explicitly referenced by the KML specification; rather, it is a construct of convenience for the pyLiveKML package.

Variables:

  • lon (float) – The longitude, in decimal degrees.

  • lat (float) – The latitude, in decimal degrees.

  • alt (Optional[float]) – The (optional) altitude, in metres.

The default maximum number of Feature objects that will be included in each synchronization update emitted by a NetworkLinkControl object.

pyLiveKML.KML.KML.kml_header: str = '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>'¶

The XML tag that opens any XML document, including any KML document.

pyLiveKML.KML.KML.kml_tag() → Element¶

Construct the opening <kml> tag, with namespaces, for a KML document.

Returns:

The <kml> tag, with namespaces, that encloses the contents of a KML document.

pyLiveKML.KML.NetworkLinkControl module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.NetworkLinkControl.NetworkLinkControl(target_href: str = '', container: Optional[Container] = None, update_limit: int = 100)¶

Bases: object

The NetworkLinkControl class synchronizes the internal state of a KML object tree rooted in its ‘container’ property with GEP.

update_kml() → Element¶

Generate a block of synchronization aircraft_data as a <NetworkLinkControl> KML tag by parsing its Container.

Returns:

The synchronization update.

Return type:

etree.Element
